page.title: 06WEMBURY BEACH 1
page.content: Wembury cove is part of the marine conservation area acquired by the {National Trust}in 1938. It is faced by the Great Mewstone,three quarters of a mile out to sea and bordered by slaty{Blackstone Rocks}to the left which continue to the right across a sandy gully to{Wembury Point.}A stream flows centrally onto the gently shelv- ing beach over{boulders,large pebbles, {shale}and{rocks}and eventually into yellow sand near low water level{140m from the concrete footbridge,high {watermark being 24.2m}from the foot- bridge. The Devon coastpath borders the beach beside a{riding paddock, descends past a{dinghy park,}a stile, traverses a footbridge, crosses a grass area supported by a{2.7m seawall and comes opposite the slate-roofed {Old Mill Cafe.}This was built over 400 years ago as an{overshoot corn mill,
